description.title: Bug fixes
description.details: Miscellaneous bug fixes.

description.title: New logging configuration panel
description.details: A new panel is available to override peer and ordering node log levels for specific component loggers.

description.title: Fabric 2.x node upgrade
description.details: It is now possible to upgrade your existing CA, peer, and ordering nodes to Fabric v2.x images.

description.title: Fabric v2.x Lifecycle support
description.details: The platform now includes support for Fabric v2.x smart contract lifecycle deployment.

description.title: Certificate renewal enhancements
description.details: Use the console to renew CA TLS, and peer or ordering node enrollment and TLS certificates from the console before or after they expire.

description.title: CA enhancement
description.details: Registered users can now be deleted from a CA.

description.title: Certificate Expiry visibility
description.details: Certificate expiration dates have been added throughout the component details and channels making it easier to monitor and track certificate expiration dates.

description.title: Bug fixes
description.details: Miscellaneous bug fixes and security patches.

description.title: Peer and ordering node images
description.details: The platform introduces the capability to deploy new peer and ordering nodes based on either Hyperledger Fabric v1.4 or v2.x.

description.title: Elimination of Docker daemon dependency
description.details: Leveraging the Fabric v2 external chaincode launcher capability, when you deploy a peer based on the Fabric v2.1.1 image, smart contracts are deployed into their own pod rather than inside a container on the peer pod.

description.title: Multizone-capable storage
description.details: If your Kubernetes cluster is configured to use multizone-capable storage, new peer and ordering nodes can be deployed that leverage multizone storage, effectively extending their high availability across cluster zones.

description.title: Support for Intermediate Certificate Authorities (CAs)
description.details: You now have the option to configure an intermediate CA using the console or APIs to override the default CA settings.

description.title: Updated connection profile
description.details: The generated connection profile that client applications use to connect to the network has been streamlined and is now downloadable from the Organizations tab.

description.title: Bug fixes
description.details: Various bug fixes

description.title: Hardware Security Module (HSM) support for node identities
description.details: Full cryptographic HSM support is now available for HSMs that implement the PKCS #11 standard.

description.title: Support for adding and removing ordering nodes from an existing ordering service
description.details: Previously, an ordering service could only contain one or five ordering nodes and they all were contributed from the same organization. Now, the ordering service can be deployed across multiple organizations in a blockchain network, enabling individual organizations to add and remove individual ordering nodes as required.

description.title: Ability to override default CA, peer, ordering node configuration
description.details: Hyperledger Fabric includes many configuration options for a CA, peer, or ordering node.

description.title: v2 APIs available
description.details: New IBM Blockchain Platform console APIs using the route /v2/ are now available.

description.title: Hyperledger Fabric v1.4.6
description.details: All new nodes are deployed using Hyperledger Fabric v1.4.6.

description.title: Bug fixes
description.details: Various bug fixes

description.title: Simplified component creation flows
description.details: Peer, CA and ordering service creation has been streamlined. Now, when you create a node, you have to select a checkbox to configure advanced deployment options.

description.title: Zone selection for ordering nodes
description.details: Allows users to deploy their ordering nodes into distributed zones.

description.title: Anchor peer during join
description.details: Users can now choose to bootstrap the automatic communication between organizations by specifying a peer as an anchor peer when the peer is being joined to the channel.

description.title: Add peer to a channel from Channels tab
description.details: A peer can now be joined to a channel directly from the Channels tab.

description.title: Export/Import all
description.details: Allows for the bulk export and import of nodes, MSPs, and identities, rather than having to export and import these components one at a time.

description.title: Hyperledger Fabric v1.4.3
description.details: All new nodes are deployed using Hyperledger Fabric v1.4.3.

description.title: Ability to update admin certs for peer nodes
description.details: You now have the ability to upload admin certs on the peers.

description.title: CA Updates
description.details: The console UI no longer uses enroll IDs and secrets for management of a CA. After you create a new CA, you now need to generate certificates yourself by using the Set identity button. Existing CAs are not affected.

description.title: Select Peer zones
description.details: When you deploy a peer and multiple zones are configured in your Kubernetes cluster, you now have the ability from the console UI to select the zone where the peer gets deployed

description.title: Peer database support now includes LevelDB
description.details: You now have the option to choose between CouchDB and LevelDB for your Peer database.

description.title: Anchor peer removal
description.details: You now have the ability to remove anchor peers from a channel.

description.title: Raft consensus protocol
description.details: The five node Raft ordering service, recommended for production networks, is now available. In addition, for development and testing purposes, you can deploy a single node Raft ordering service

description.title: Console APIs
description.details: APIs are now available to provision, edit, and delete peer, orderer, and CA nodes, making it possible to script the building of your blockchain network.

description.title: Channel Governance
description.details: Channel updates now allow policies to be reconfigured. You can also control which channel members need to sign a channel update and orchestrate signature collection

description.title: Resource Allocation
description.details: Ability to specify resource allocation for nodes in paid cluster during deployment and then scale their resources up or down at a later time according to usage patterns.

description.title: Identity and Access Management
description.details: Use Identity and Access Management (IAM) to control user access to the console UI.

description.title: Support for External CA
description.details: You have the option to use certificates from an external CA, one that is not hosted by IBM.

description.title: Tuning orderer performance
description.details: New orderer tuning parameters are available in the console to give you more control over your orderer throughput and performance.
